title: A Petition For Blight Crystal Sion
body:
Sion hasn’t had a skin since before he got his visual rework (which I’m frankly in love with). His other skins were brought up to date along with his default appearance, but none of them appeal to me. For some, they do; not for me. But Sion's VU has broadened the potential for future skins. It was wasteful to consider giving him another skin pre-VU, and a shame to force the art team to work within such tight confines. That's no longer the case; he's a modern contender now in the art and tech department. So why not give him a skin to test his newfound limits?

I present **Blight Crystal Sion** for the case. The pictures below are of Absalom, the central antagonist of a game called Darksiders II. Brace yourself: tangent incoming. Darksiders was a charming albeit short-lived series I’ve grown rather fond of; primarily of its art. Some criticize its "cartoony" art style, but I find it more captivating than most "high fidelity" dirt-and-grit games. The art style shares some similarities with League's; heck, I think Darksiders may have even swayed me into liking the VU'd Summoner’s Rift. Tangent over.

https://ngplusblog.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/475_max.jpg?w=1000&h=&crop=1

Coming back to what’s relevant to Sion here, let’s talk about Absalom. As you can see, the guy is nothing short of huge. Massive, even. He towers over the game's protagonist and definitely outweighs him several times over. Sort of like Sion now, towards most of the champ roster. You may notice some other similarities between him and our Undead Juggernaut. Both have a prominent lower jaw; broad shoulders; so thick a neck it calls into question whether it exists; an asymmetrical upper body, the off arm being larger and spikier than the dominant arm, with which they can ram obstacles (Sion uses said shoulder when attacking towers); have exposed torsos with numerous scars and a prominent pectoral injury that’s been closed shut but poorly; wear high-riding belts that double as abdomen armor; have pretty thick boots and greaves; and in case you haven’t noticed… **A BIG HONKING AXE.**

http://www.gamearthub.net/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/Darksiders_2_characters_tohankim-darksiders-ii-6.jpg

http://i.neoseeker.com/n/2/sion_skins.png

Look at these two: They're practically identical brothers! I hope you can see that, I really do! Otherwise I'd question whether or not you’re a monk. Join me, brothers and sisters and fellow creatures, help make this a reality. Sion deserves something, even if it isn’t this.

Not sure I'm a fan of the Blight Crystal line, but I agree that Sion definitely needs a new post-rework skin.

On the topic of Darksiders... I played the first game and it was pretty fun, but my God did it steal literally every aspect of its design from other games.
Stolen and put to good use, I say.

Darksiders in my opinion is best described as the lovechild of God of War and the Legend of Zelda with a surprisingly detailed backstory loosely based on biblical mythos. It's true to say it stole key gameplay elements, but it's also true to say that it did it well and is a fantastic game.

Traditionally (originally) the First Rider, the White Rider, is Conquest. Conquest was replaced in the Renaissance with Pestilence.

Strife (Conquest) leads to War, War leads to Fury (Famine), Fury (Famine) leads to Death.

Also: Strife in Darksiders is the Ranged. He's dual-wielding revolvers.
